item.title: On the Value of Formal Education
item.description: Over the past few years, I’ve started to see a multitude of online videos/articles about the weakening value of college, particularly in the area of computer science. Whether it’s Devon Crawford talking about how he dropped out of school or Mashable writing an article trashing CS degrees, the popular view on the internet seems to be “Eh, just learn it on your own.” I’ve struggled with my opinion significantly on this topic, but overall, I think this view is deeply flawed.
